content: perforated bucket hat this is a beginner-friendly guide for making a perforated bucket hat using tape yarn tape yarn is a flat polyester yarn that works up similarly to raffia it creates a lightweight soft fabric that looks like basket weaving to follow this pattern you should already know basic crochet techniques including magic_ring or chain ring double_crochet double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet slip_stitch increases 2 stitches in the same stitch what you ll need tape yarn polyester niceec brand on amazon available in 2 or 6 skein packs each skein = 109 yds 4mm crochet hook tapestry needle and scissors for finishing you ll use a little over 1 skein for this hat about 125 yards total you can substitute with cotton yarn but the structure and look will vary sizing guide this hat is worked from the top down steps 1 7 create the crown top of the hat adjust the diameter of the crown to match your head circumference tip half_double_crochet rounds account for 1/2 an inch while double_crochet rounds will be 1 inch *inches could vary due to gauge* head circumference crown diameter inches inches 16 18 - average child 18 5 5 20 - average teen 20 22 - 6 average female 22 24 - 6 5 average male 7 instructions crown top of hat beginner tip slip_stitch to the top of your chain when joining rounds round 1 start with a magic_ring or chain ring chain 3 counts as first double_crochet then make 11 double_crochet into the ring 24 total stitches slip_stitch to join chain 3 round 2 your chain 3 will be your first double_crochet for this round make 2 double_crochet in each stitch 24 total slip_stitch to join chain 3 counts as first double_crochet for next round round 3 double_crochet in same stitch as chain 3 double_crochet in next stitch 2 double_crochet in the following stitch repeat this pattern around for 36 total stitches slip_stitch to join chain 3 counts as first double_crochet for next round round 4 double_crochet in same stitch as chain 3 double_crochet in next 2 stitches 2 double_crochet in the next stitch repeat this pattern around for 48 total stitches slip_stitch to join chain 3 counts as first double_crochet for next round round 5 double_crochet in next 3 stitches 2 double_crochet in the 4th stitch repeat around for 60 total stitches slip_stitch to join chain 3 counts as first double_crochet for next round round 6 double_crochet in next 4 stitches 2 double_crochet in the 5th stitch repeat around for 72 total stitches slip_stitch to join chain 3 round 7 optional for larger size double_crochet in next 5 stitches 2 double_crochet in the 6th stitch repeat around to create a 7 crown 84 total stitches for smaller sizes follow sizing guide for head circumference slip_stitch to join chain 1 counts as first half_double_crochet for next round make sure to stop at the round that matches the size in the sizing guide for a better fit sides of the hat
